objective: Develop the fundamental skills of acting and performance.
content: Voice, body movement, improvisation, and character development.
specific_objectives: Use vocal techniques (projection, articulation, tone) effectively
Demonstrate physical expression through body movement and mime
Utilize improvisation to build character and explore dramatic situations
Develop a believable character using internal and external techniques
Explain the importance of focus and concentration in performance

objective: Analyze the evolution and cultural significance of theatre.
content: Traditional Caribbean performances (Jonkonnu, Carnival), Greek theatre, and modern realism.
specific_objectives: Trace the history of traditional Caribbean performance forms
Discuss the influence of African and European heritages on West Indian drama
Identify characteristics of major theatrical periods (e.g., Elizabethan, Realism)
Analyze the role of theatre in reflecting and challenging social issues
Discuss the work of influential Caribbean playwrights and directors

objective: Understand the technical and organizational aspects of a production.
content: Set design, lighting, costume, make-up, and stage management.
specific_objectives: Describe the functions of set design and props
Explain how lighting and sound contribute to mood and atmosphere
Analyze the role of costume and make-up in characterization
Describe the duties of the Stage Manager and production crew
Create a production schedule and prompt book

objective: Evaluate theatrical works and understand the director's vision.
content: The director's concept, script analysis, and writing theatre reviews.
specific_objectives: Deconstruct a script to identify themes, conflict, and plot structure
Explain the concept of 'Director's Vision' or 'Directorial Concept'
Evaluate a theatrical performance using appropriate terminology
Write a critical review of a play or production
Discuss the collaborative nature of theatre production
